communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

November 3, 2024
Food and Drug Administration
Division of Freedom of Information (HFI-35)

RE:  Freedom of Information Act request

Dear FOIA Officer:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a, I am requesting all correspondence between FDA agency staff and drug sponsors of Lecanemab (application 761269Orig1s000) including all meeting records/minutes/notes documenting interactions between agency staff and Esai inc. or Biogen personnel regarding the drug, lecanemab (Leqembi) from December 1, 2023 through the present November 3, 2024 related to the following search terms: "deaths" "died" "mortality" "death rate". This should include any references to journalists reporting on Leqembi by FDA agency staff whether or not the communication includes an employee of Eisai or Biogen.

I am a professional journalist writing for The BMJ. 
 
As an investigative journalist, I request a waiver of fees associated with processing this FOIA request and duplicating responsive records.  

Thank you for your attention to this request.

Sincerely,


Jeanne Lenzer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeanne Lenzer

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

November 3, 2024
Food and Drug Administration
Division of Freedom of Information (HFI-35)

Expedited Freedom of Information Act request

Dear FOIA Officer:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a, and under FDA’s expedited processing regulation 21 CFR § 20.44 I am requesting all materials, emails, phone records, logs, as contained in any media format regarding donanemab (Kisunla) BLA # 761248 from communications between FDA and Kisunla's cmanufacturer, Eli Lilly from March 1, 2021 through November 1, 2024. I request such communications in any format including emails, meeting notes or recordings/transcripts whether they are intra-FDA communications or externally with Lilly. I further request any communications between the FDA and Lilly regarding public reporting on Kisunla in any media - please use the search term "BMJ" as well as the "New York Times" and "STAT".  

I am requesting an expedited response as Kisunla has been shown to have a concerning rate of deaths and has been mandated by the FDA to file ongoing death data with the agency and this information is in the public interest and is not reliably available in the public database (FAERS). 

I am a professional journalist writing for The BMJ and other media outlets.
 
As an investigative journalist, I request a waiver of fees associated with processing this FOIA request and duplicating responsive records.  

Thank you for your attention to this request.

Sincerely,


Jeanne Lenzer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeanne Lenzer
